elements.name: applicantIntroExplanation
elements.title:
Intro paragraph
pick applicants
explain what that means
here's a list of everyone you've identified so far. time to figure who is actually applying (applicant can be someone you haven't yet identified)
Now we need to learn more about you as the applicant.
If you are not the only applicant, we will also ask questions related to the other applicants.
Now we need to learn more about the people who are applying to represent the deceased. Applicants are commonly the people you've noted down in the previous step. They can also be someone different. You will have to opportunity to identify all applicants in this step.
Now that we have asked about 's family members, we will ask for information about you to help the Supreme Court of BC decide whether they should make you 's personal representative(s).
Applicants (people applying) are usually family members who inherit 's assets. However, people who are not inheriting the assets can also apply.
